table.name: app_versions
table.remarks: Minimum and recommended versions for Terraware mobile apps.

table.name: countries
table.remarks: Country information per ISO-3166.

column.name: code
column.remarks: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code. We use this code to refer to countries elsewhere in the data model.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Name of country in US English.

column.name: code_alpha3
column.remarks: ISO-3166 alpha-3 country code. This is used in cases where an external system or user needs an alpha-3 code instad of an alpha-2 code, but is treated purely as descriptive data in the data model.

column.name: eligible
column.remarks: If false, projects in this country are ineligible for the accelerator program.

table.name: country_subdivisions
table.remarks: Country subdivision (state, province, region, etc.) information per ISO-3166-2.

column.name: code
column.remarks: Full ISO-3166-2 subdivision code including country code prefix.

column.name: country_code
column.remarks: ISO-3166 alpha-2 country code.

column.name: name
column.remarks: Name of subdivision in US English.

table.name: device_managers
table.remarks: Information about device managers. This is a combination of information from the Balena API and locally-generated values.

column.name: balena_id
column.remarks: Balena-assigned device identifier.

column.name: balena_modified_time
column.remarks: Last modification timestamp from Balena. This is distinct from `refreshed_time`, which is updated locally.

column.name: update_progress
column.remarks: Percent complete of software download and installation (0-100). Null if no software update is in progress.

column.name: sensor_kit_id
column.remarks: ID code that is physically printed on the sensor kit and set as a tag value in the Balena device configuration.

column.name: created_time
column.remarks: When this device manager was added to the local database. The Balena device may have been created earlier.

checkConstraint.constraint: (((user_id IS NOT NULL) AND (facility_id IS NOT NULL)) OR ((user_id IS NULL) AND (facility_id IS NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: device_managers_user_iff_facility

table.name: disclaimers
table.remarks: Disclaimers content and effective dates.

table.name: facilities
table.remarks: Physical locations at a site. For example, each seed bank and each nursery is a facility.

column.name: max_idle_minutes
column.remarks: Send an alert if this many minutes pass without new timeseries data from a facility's device manager.

column.name: last_timeseries_time
column.remarks: When the most recent timeseries data was received from the facility.

column.name: idle_after_time
column.remarks: Time at which the facility will be considered idle if no timeseries data is received. Null if the timeseries has already been marked as idle or if no timeseries data has ever been received from the facility.

column.name: idle_since_time
column.remarks: Time at which the facility became idle. Null if the facility is not currently considered idle.

column.name: last_notification_date
column.remarks: Local date on which facility-related notifications were last generated.

column.name: next_notification_time
column.remarks: Time at which the server should next generate notifications for the facility if any are needed.

table.name: facility_connection_states
table.remarks: (Enum) Progress of the configuration of a device manager for a facility.

table.name: facility_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Types of facilities that can be represented in the data model.

table.name: files
table.remarks: Generic information about individual files. Files are associated with application entities using linking tables such as `accession_photos`.

column.name: captured_local_time
column.remarks: If applicable, the date and time in the local time zone of wherever the file's data was captured. For example, the time a photo was taken. This may differ from `created_time`, which represents when the file was stored in Terraware. This is typically extracted from the file itself, e.g., EXIF metadata.

column.name: geolocation
column.remarks: If applicable, the location where the file was created. For photos, typically extracted from EXIF metadata.

table.name: global_roles
table.remarks: (Enum) System-wide roles that can be assigned to users. Global roles are not tied to organizations. These are generally for system or business administration; most users have no global roles.

table.name: internal_tags
table.remarks: Internal (non-user-facing) tags. Low-numbered tags are defined by the system; the rest may be edited by super admins.

table.name: land_use_model_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Types of ways a project's land can be used.

table.name: managed_location_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Type of managed location for business analytics purposes.

table.name: notification_criticalities
table.remarks: (Enum) Criticality information of notifications in the application.

table.name: notification_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Types of notifications in the application.

table.name: notifications
table.remarks: Notifications for application users.

table.name: organization_internal_tags
table.remarks: Which internal (non-user-facing) tags apply to which organizations.

table.name: organization_managed_location_types
table.remarks: Per-organization information about managed location types for business analytics purposes.

table.name: organization_report_settings
table.remarks: Organization-level settings for quarterly reports. Project-level settings are in `project_report_settings`.

table.name: organization_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Type of forestry organization for business analytics purposes.

table.name: organization_users
table.remarks: Organization membership and role information.

table.name: organizations
table.remarks: Top-level information about organizations.

column.name: id
column.remarks: Unique numeric identifier of the organization.

column.name: organization_type_details
column.remarks: User provided information on the organization when type is Other, limited to 100 characters.

column.name: website
column.remarks: Website information for the organization with no formatting restrictions.

checkConstraint.constraint: (((organization_type_details IS NULL) AND (organization_type_id <> 6)) OR ((organization_type_details IS NOT NULL) AND (organization_type_id = 6)))
checkConstraint.name: other_type_details_only_for_other

table.name: project_internal_roles
table.remarks: (Enum) Roles a user is allowed to have on a project.

table.name: project_internal_users
table.remarks: Which users have which internal roles on a project.

table.name: project_land_use_model_types
table.remarks: Which projects have which types of land use models.

table.name: project_report_settings
table.remarks: Which projects require reports to be submitted each quarter. Organization-level settings are in `organization_report_settings`.

table.name: projects
table.remarks: Distinguishes among an organization's projects.

table.name: regions
table.remarks: (Enum) Parts of the world where countries are located.

table.name: roles
table.remarks: (Enum) Roles a user is allowed to have in an organization.

table.name: seed_fund_report_files
table.remarks: Linking table between `reports` and `files` for non-photo files.

table.name: seed_fund_report_photos
table.remarks: Linking table between `reports` and `files` for photos.

table.name: seed_fund_report_statuses
table.remarks: (Enum) Describes where in the workflow each partner report is.

table.name: seed_fund_reports
table.remarks: Partner-submitted reports about their organizations and projects.

column.name: project_id
column.remarks: If this report is for a specific project and the project still exists, the project ID. If the project has been deleted, this will be null but `project_name` will still be populated.

column.name: project_name
column.remarks: If this report is for a specific project, the name of the project as of the time the report was submitted.

checkConstraint.constraint: (((locked_by IS NULL) AND (locked_time IS NULL)) OR ((locked_by IS NOT NULL) AND (locked_time IS NOT NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: locked_by_and_time_both_set

checkConstraint.constraint: (((locked_by IS NULL) AND (status_id <> 3)) OR ((locked_by IS NOT NULL) AND (status_id = 3)))
checkConstraint.name: status_reflects_locked

checkConstraint.constraint: (((submitted_by IS NULL) AND (status_id <> 4)) OR ((submitted_by IS NOT NULL) AND (status_id = 4)))
checkConstraint.name: status_reflects_submitted

checkConstraint.constraint: (((submitted_by IS NULL) AND (submitted_time IS NULL)) OR ((submitted_by IS NOT NULL) AND (submitted_time IS NOT NULL)))
checkConstraint.name: submitted_by_and_time_both_set

table.name: upload_problem_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Specific types of problems encountered while processing a user-uploaded file.

table.name: upload_problems
table.remarks: Details about problems (validation failures, etc.) in user-uploaded files.

column.name: position
column.remarks: Where in the uploaded file the problem appears, or null if it is a problem with the file as a whole. This may be a byte offset, a line number, or a record number depending on the type of file.

column.name: field
column.remarks: If the problem pertains to a specific field, its name. Null if the problem affects an entire record or the entire file.

table.name: upload_statuses
table.remarks: (Enum) Available statuses of user-uploaded files. Uploads progress through these statuses as the system processes the files.

column.name: finished
column.remarks: If true, this status means that the system is finished processing the file.

table.name: upload_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Types of user-uploaded files whose progress can be tracked in the uploads table.

column.name: expire_files
column.remarks: Old rows are automatically deleted from the uploads table. If this value is true, files will also be removed from the file store for old uploads of this type.

table.name: uploads
table.remarks: Information about the status of files uploaded by users. This is used to track the progress of file processing such as importing datafiles; contents of this table may expire and be deleted after a certain amount of time.

table.name: user_disclaimers
table.remarks: Records of user acceptance of disclaimers.

table.name: user_global_roles
table.remarks: Which users have which global roles.

table.name: user_preferences
table.remarks: Client-defined preferences that should persist across browser sessions.

column.name: organization_id
column.remarks: If null, preferences are global to the user. Otherwise, they are specific to the user and the organization.

table.name: user_types
table.remarks: (Enum) Types of users. Most users are of type 1, "Individual."

table.name: users
table.remarks: User identities. A user can be associated with organizations via `organization_users`.

column.name: auth_id
column.remarks: Unique identifier of the user in the authentication system. Currently, this is a Keycloak user ID.

column.name: last_activity_time
column.remarks: When the user most recently interacted with the system.

column.name: email_notifications_enabled
column.remarks: If true, the user wants to receive notifications via email.

routine.name: _postgis_deprecate(oldname text, newname text, version text)
_postgis_pgsql_version()
_postgis_selectivity(tbl regclass, att_name text, geom geometry, mode text DEFAULT '2'::text)
_st_concavehull(param_inputgeom geometry)
_st_dwithin(geog1 geography, geog2 geography, tolerance double precision, use_spheroid boolean DEFAULT true)
_st_dwithinuncached(geography, geography, double precision)
routine.definition: SELECT $1 OPERATOR(public.&&) public._ST_Expand($2,$3) AND $2 OPERATOR(public.&&) public._ST_Expand($1,$3) AND public._ST_DWithinUnCached($1, $2, $3, true)

routine.name: _st_voronoi(g1 geometry, clip geometry DEFAULT NULL::geometry, tolerance double precision DEFAULT 0.0, return_polygons boolean DEFAULT true)

addgeometrycolumn(catalog_name character varying, schema_name character varying, table_name character varying, column_name character varying, new_srid_in integer, new_type character varying, new_dim integer, use_typmod boolean DEFAULT true)

addgeometrycolumn(schema_name character varying, table_name character varying, column_name character varying, new_srid integer, new_type character varying, new_dim integer, use_typmod boolean DEFAULT true)
addgeometrycolumn(table_name character varying, column_name character varying, new_srid integer, new_type character varying, new_dim integer, use_typmod boolean DEFAULT true)
column_exists(ptable text, pcolumn text)
routine.definition: -- does the requested table.column exist in schema? SELECT EXISTS (SELECT NULL FROM information_schema.columns WHERE table_name = ptable AND column_name = pcolumn );

routine.name: dropgeometrycolumn(catalog_name character varying, schema_name character varying, table_name character varying, column_name character varying)
dropgeometrycolumn(schema_name character varying, table_name character varying, column_name character varying)
dropgeometrycolumn(table_name character varying, column_name character varying)
dropgeometrytable(catalog_name character varying, schema_name character varying, table_name character varying)
dropgeometrytable(schema_name character varying, table_name character varying)
each(hs hstore, OUT key text, OUT value text)
event_log_create_id_index(IN field_name text)
routine.comment: Creates an index on the event_log table for a top-level field in the event payload. The field is treated as a BIGINT. Only rows that have a non-null value for the field are indexed. The event class is included as a secondary key to support "all events of type X for entity Y" queries.

routine.name: find_srid(character varying, character varying, character varying)
gbt_float8_consistent(internal, double precision, smallint, oid, internal)
gbt_float8_distance(internal, double precision, smallint, oid, internal)
gbt_time_consistent(internal, time without time zone, smallint, oid, internal)
gbt_time_distance(internal, time without time zone, smallint, oid, internal)
gbt_timetz_consistent(internal, time with time zone, smallint, oid, internal)
gbt_ts_consistent(internal, timestamp without time zone, smallint, oid, internal)
gbt_ts_distance(internal, timestamp without time zone, smallint, oid, internal)
gbt_tstz_consistent(internal, timestamp with time zone, smallint, oid, internal)
gbt_tstz_distance(internal, timestamp with time zone, smallint, oid, internal)
get_proj4_from_srid(integer)
gin_consistent_hstore(internal, smallint, hstore, integer, internal, internal)
gin_extract_query_trgm(text, internal, smallint, internal, internal, internal, internal)
gin_trgm_consistent(internal, smallint, text, integer, internal, internal, internal, internal)
gin_trgm_triconsistent(internal, smallint, text, integer, internal, internal, internal)
levenshtein_less_equal(text, text, integer, integer, integer, integer)
pgis_asmvt_transfn(internal, anyelement, text, integer, text, text)
populate_geometry_columns(tbl_oid oid, use_typmod boolean DEFAULT true)
populate_geometry_columns(use_typmod boolean DEFAULT true)
postgis_constraint_dims(geomschema text, geomtable text, geomcolumn text)
routine.definition: SELECT replace(split_part(s.consrc, ' = ', 2), ')', '')::integer FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%ndims(% = %';

routine.name: postgis_constraint_srid(geomschema text, geomtable text, geomcolumn text)
routine.definition: SELECT replace(replace(split_part(s.consrc, ' = ', 2), ')', ''), '(', '')::integer FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%srid(% = %';

routine.name: postgis_constraint_type(geomschema text, geomtable text, geomcolumn text)
routine.definition: SELECT replace(split_part(s.consrc, '''', 2), ')', '')::varchar FROM pg_class c, pg_namespace n, pg_attribute a , (SELECT connamespace, conrelid, conkey, pg_get_constraintdef(oid) As consrc FROM pg_constraint) AS s WHERE n.nspname = $1 AND c.relname = $2 AND a.attname = $3 AND a.attrelid = c.oid AND s.connamespace = n.oid AND s.conrelid = c.oid AND a.attnum = ANY (s.conkey) AND s.consrc LIKE '%geometrytype(% = %';

routine.name: postgis_extensions_upgrade(target_version text DEFAULT NULL::text)
postgis_full_version()
postgis_srs(auth_name text, auth_srid text)
routine.returnType: TABLE(auth_name text, auth_srid text, srname text, srtext text, proj4text text, point_sw geometry, point_ne geometry)

routine.name: postgis_srs_all()
routine.returnType: TABLE(auth_name text, auth_srid text, srname text, srtext text, proj4text text, point_sw geometry, point_ne geometry)

routine.name: postgis_srs_search(bounds geometry, authname text DEFAULT 'EPSG'::text)
routine.returnType: TABLE(auth_name text, auth_srid text, srname text, srtext text, proj4text text, point_sw geometry, point_ne geometry)

routine.name: postgis_transform_pipeline_geometry(geom geometry, pipeline text, forward boolean, to_srid integer)
postgis_type_name(geomname character varying, coord_dimension integer, use_new_name boolean DEFAULT true)
routine.definition:
SELECT CASE WHEN $3 THEN new_name ELSE old_name END As geomname FROM ( VALUES ('GEOMETRY', 'Geometry', 2), ('GEOMETRY', 'GeometryZ', 3), ('GEOMETRYM', 'GeometryM', 3), ('GEOMETRY', 'GeometryZM', 4),
('GEOMETRYCOLLECTION', 'GeometryCollection', 2), ('GEOMETRYCOLLECTION', 'GeometryCollectionZ', 3), ('GEOMETRYCOLLECTIONM', 'GeometryCollectionM', 3), ('GEOMETRYCOLLECTION', 'GeometryCollectionZM', 4),
('POINT', 'Point', 2), ('POINT', 'PointZ', 3), ('POINTM','PointM', 3), ('POINT', 'PointZM', 4),
('MULTIPOINT','MultiPoint', 2), ('MULTIPOINT','MultiPointZ', 3), ('MULTIPOINTM','MultiPointM', 3), ('MULTIPOINT','MultiPointZM', 4),
('POLYGON', 'Polygon', 2), ('POLYGON', 'PolygonZ', 3), ('POLYGONM', 'PolygonM', 3), ('POLYGON', 'PolygonZM', 4),
('MULTIPOLYGON', 'MultiPolygon', 2), ('MULTIPOLYGON', 'MultiPolygonZ', 3), ('MULTIPOLYGONM', 'MultiPolygonM', 3), ('MULTIPOLYGON', 'MultiPolygonZM', 4),
('MULTILINESTRING', 'MultiLineString', 2), ('MULTILINESTRING', 'MultiLineStringZ', 3), ('MULTILINESTRINGM', 'MultiLineStringM', 3), ('MULTILINESTRING', 'MultiLineStringZM', 4),
('LINESTRING', 'LineString', 2), ('LINESTRING', 'LineStringZ', 3), ('LINESTRINGM', 'LineStringM', 3), ('LINESTRING', 'LineStringZM', 4),
('CIRCULARSTRING', 'CircularString', 2), ('CIRCULARSTRING', 'CircularStringZ', 3), ('CIRCULARSTRINGM', 'CircularStringM' ,3), ('CIRCULARSTRING', 'CircularStringZM', 4),
('COMPOUNDCURVE', 'CompoundCurve', 2), ('COMPOUNDCURVE', 'CompoundCurveZ', 3), ('COMPOUNDCURVEM', 'CompoundCurveM', 3), ('COMPOUNDCURVE', 'CompoundCurveZM', 4),
('CURVEPOLYGON', 'CurvePolygon', 2), ('CURVEPOLYGON', 'CurvePolygonZ', 3), ('CURVEPOLYGONM', 'CurvePolygonM', 3), ('CURVEPOLYGON', 'CurvePolygonZM', 4),
('MULTICURVE', 'MultiCurve', 2), ('MULTICURVE', 'MultiCurveZ', 3), ('MULTICURVEM', 'MultiCurveM', 3), ('MULTICURVE', 'MultiCurveZM', 4),
('MULTISURFACE', 'MultiSurface', 2), ('MULTISURFACE', 'MultiSurfaceZ', 3), ('MULTISURFACEM', 'MultiSurfaceM', 3), ('MULTISURFACE', 'MultiSurfaceZM', 4),
('POLYHEDRALSURFACE', 'PolyhedralSurface', 2), ('POLYHEDRALSURFACE', 'PolyhedralSurfaceZ', 3), ('POLYHEDRALSURFACEM', 'PolyhedralSurfaceM', 3), ('POLYHEDRALSURFACE', 'PolyhedralSurfaceZM', 4),
('TRIANGLE', 'Triangle', 2), ('TRIANGLE', 'TriangleZ', 3), ('TRIANGLEM', 'TriangleM', 3), ('TRIANGLE', 'TriangleZM', 4),
('TIN', 'Tin', 2), ('TIN', 'TinZ', 3), ('TINM', 'TinM', 3), ('TIN', 'TinZM', 4) ) As g(old_name, new_name, coord_dimension) WHERE (upper(old_name) = upper($1) OR upper(new_name) = upper($1)) AND coord_dimension = $2;

routine.name: rename_column_if_exists(ptable text, pcolumn text, new_name text)
routine.definition: BEGIN -- Rename the column if it exists. IF column_exists(ptable, pcolumn) THEN EXECUTE FORMAT('ALTER TABLE %I RENAME COLUMN %I TO %I;', ptable, pcolumn, new_name); END IF; END

routine.name: st_3ddfullywithin(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, double precision)
st_3ddwithin(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, double precision)

st_asgeojson(geom geometry, maxdecimaldigits integer DEFAULT 9, options integer DEFAULT 8)

st_asgml(geom geometry, maxdecimaldigits integer DEFAULT 15, options integer DEFAULT 0)
st_asgml(version integer, geog geography, maxdecimaldigits integer DEFAULT 15, options integer DEFAULT 0, nprefix text DEFAULT 'gml'::text, id text DEFAULT ''::text)
st_asgml(version integer, geom geometry, maxdecimaldigits integer DEFAULT 15, options integer DEFAULT 0, nprefix text DEFAULT NULL::text, id text DEFAULT NULL::text)
st_askml(geog geography, maxdecimaldigits integer DEFAULT 15, nprefix text DEFAULT ''::text)
st_askml(geom geometry, maxdecimaldigits integer DEFAULT 15, nprefix text DEFAULT ''::text)

st_astwkb(geom geometry[], ids bigint[], prec integer DEFAULT NULL::integer, prec_z integer DEFAULT NULL::integer, prec_m integer DEFAULT NULL::integer, with_sizes boolean DEFAULT NULL::boolean, with_boxes boolean DEFAULT NULL::boolean)

st_bdmpolyfromtext(text, integer)
st_bdpolyfromtext(text, integer)
st_boundingdiagonal(geom geometry, fits boolean DEFAULT false)

st_buffer(geom geometry, radius double precision, quadsegs integer)

st_closestpoint(geography, geography, use_spheroid boolean DEFAULT true)
st_clusterdbscan(geometry, eps double precision, minpoints integer)
st_clusterkmeans(geom geometry, k integer, max_radius double precision DEFAULT NULL::double precision)

st_coverageinvalidedges(geom geometry, tolerance double precision DEFAULT 0.0)
st_coveragesimplify(geom geometry, tolerance double precision, simplifyboundary boolean DEFAULT true)
st_curvetoline(geom geometry, tol double precision DEFAULT 32, toltype integer DEFAULT 0, flags integer DEFAULT 0)
st_delaunaytriangles(g1 geometry, tolerance double precision DEFAULT 0.0, flags integer DEFAULT 0)
st_dfullywithin(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, double precision)
st_difference(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, gridsize double precision DEFAULT '-1.0'::numeric)
st_distance(geog1 geography, geog2 geography, use_spheroid boolean DEFAULT true)
st_distancesphere(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, radius double precision)
st_dwithin(geog1 geography, geog2 geography, tolerance double precision, use_spheroid boolean DEFAULT true)
st_dwithin(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, double precision)
st_expand(box box2d, dx double precision, dy double precision)
st_expand(box box3d, dx double precision, dy double precision, dz double precision DEFAULT 0)
st_expand(geom geometry, dx double precision, dy double precision, dz double precision DEFAULT 0, dm double precision DEFAULT 0)
st_filterbym(geometry, double precision, double precision DEFAULT NULL::double precision, boolean DEFAULT false)
st_findextent(text, text)
st_findextent(text, text, text)
st_force3d(geom geometry, zvalue double precision DEFAULT 0.0)
st_force3dm(geom geometry, mvalue double precision DEFAULT 0.0)
st_force3dz(geom geometry, zvalue double precision DEFAULT 0.0)
st_force4d(geom geometry, zvalue double precision DEFAULT 0.0, mvalue double precision DEFAULT 0.0)
st_frechetdistance(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, double precision DEFAULT '-1'::integer)
st_generatepoints(area geometry, npoints integer, seed integer)
st_geomcollfromtext(text)
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1)) = 'GEOMETRYCOLLECTION' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_geomcollfromtext(text, integer)
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1, $2)) = 'GEOMETRYCOLLECTION' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1,$2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_geomcollfromwkb(bytea)
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1)) = 'GEOMETRYCOLLECTION' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_geomcollfromwkb(bytea, integer)
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2)) = 'GEOMETRYCOLLECTION' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_geometricmedian(g geometry, tolerance double precision DEFAULT NULL::double precision, max_iter integer DEFAULT 10000, fail_if_not_converged boolean DEFAULT false)
st_hausdorffdistance(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, double precision)
st_hexagon(size double precision, cell_i integer, cell_j integer, origin geometry DEFAULT '010100000000000000000000000000000000000000'::geometry)
st_hexagongrid(size double precision, bounds geometry, OUT geom geometry, OUT i integer, OUT j integer)
st_intersection(geom1 geometry, geom2 geometry, gridsize double precision DEFAULT '-1'::integer)
st_inversetransformpipeline(geom geometry, pipeline text, to_srid integer DEFAULT 0)
st_isvalidreason(geometry, integer)

st_largestemptycircle(geom geometry, tolerance double precision DEFAULT 0.0, boundary geometry DEFAULT '0101000000000000000000F87F000000000000F87F'::geometry, OUT center geometry, OUT nearest geometry, OUT radius double precision)
st_length(geog geography, use_spheroid boolean DEFAULT true)
st_letters(letters text, font json DEFAULT NULL::json)
routine.definition:

"i":"", "j":"", "k":"BgABARKoA/QFIAC0AYoD5gIAjwK5BJICwwTfAgDDAbIDFwAAnwMSEeUCABISAJILERLmAgAREQCvBQ==", "n":"", "m":"", "l":"BgABAQnAAwDrAgASFgDWCxEa6gIAERkA0wsUFw==", "y":"", "q":"", "p":"", "o":"", "s":"", "t":"BgABAUe8BLACWAAaEADRAhsOaQANAA0ADwINAA0CDQANAg0CDQINBA0CCwYNBA0GCwYNBgsIDQgLCAsKCwgJDAsKCQwJDAkOCQ4HEAcSBxIHEgUUAOAEawAVEQDWAhYTbAAAygIVFOYCABUXAMUCogEAFhQA1QIVEqEBAADzAwIFBAMEBQQDBAMEAwYDBgMGAwYBCAEGAQgBBgEIAAgA", "w":"BgABARz8BsAEINYCKNgBERLuAgARD+8B3QgSEc0CABQSW7YCV7UCFBHJAgASEpMC3AgREvACABERmAHxBDDaAVeYAxES7gIAEREo1QE81wIIAA==", "z":"BgABAQ6cA9AGuQIAFw8AzAIaC9QFAAAr9wKjBuACABYQAMsCGQyZBgCaA9AG" }'; BEGIN
IF font IS NULL THEN font := font_default; END IF;
-- For character spacing, use m as guide size geom := ST_GeomFromTWKB(decode(font->>'m', 'base64')); m_width := ST_XMax(geom) - ST_XMin(geom); spacing := m_width / 12;
letterarray := regexp_split_to_array(replace(letters, ' ', E'\t'), E''); FOREACH letter IN ARRAY letterarray LOOP geom := ST_GeomFromTWKB(decode(font->>(letter), 'base64')); -- Chars are not already zeroed out, so do it now geom := ST_Translate(geom, -1 * ST_XMin(geom), 0.0); -- unknown characters are treated as spaces IF geom IS NULL THEN -- spaces are a "quarter m" in width width := m_width / 3.5; ELSE width := (ST_XMax(geom) - ST_XMin(geom)); END IF; geom := ST_Translate(geom, position, 0.0); -- Tighten up spacing when characters have a large gap -- between them like Yo or To adjustment := 0.0; IF prevgeom IS NOT NULL AND geom IS NOT NULL THEN dist = ST_Distance(prevgeom, geom); IF dist > spacing THEN adjustment = spacing - dist; geom := ST_Translate(geom, adjustment, 0.0); END IF; END IF; prevgeom := geom; position := position + width + spacing + adjustment; wordarr := array_append(wordarr, geom); END LOOP; -- apply the start point and scaling options wordgeom := ST_CollectionExtract(ST_Collect(wordarr)); wordgeom := ST_Scale(wordgeom, text_height/font_default_height, text_height/font_default_height); return wordgeom; END;

routine.name: st_lineextend(geom geometry, distance_forward double precision, distance_backward double precision DEFAULT 0.0)
st_linefromtext(text)
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1)) = 'LINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_linefromtext(text, integer)
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromText($1, $2)) = 'LINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromText($1,$2) ELSE NULL END

routine.name: st_linefromwkb(bytea)
routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1)) = 'LINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1) ELSE NULL END

routine.definition: SELECT CASE WHEN public.geometrytype(public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2)) = 'LINESTRING' THEN public.ST_GeomFromWKB($1, $2) ELSE NULL END

st_rotate(geometry, double precision, geometry)
routine.definition: SELECT public.ST_Affine($1, cos($2), -sin($2), 0, sin($2), cos($2), 0, 0, 0, 1, public.ST_X($3) - cos($2) * public.ST_X($3) + sin($2) * public.ST_Y($3), public.ST_Y($3) - sin($2) * public.ST_X($3) - cos($2) * public.ST_Y($3), 0)

st_simplifypolygonhull(geom geometry, vertex_fraction double precision, is_outer boolean DEFAULT true)

st_tileenvelope(zoom integer, x integer, y integer, bounds geometry DEFAULT '0102000020110F00000200000093107C45F81B73C193107C45F81B73C193107C45F81B734193107C45F81B7341'::geometry, margin double precision DEFAULT 0.0)
st_transform(geom geometry, from_proj text, to_proj text)
st_transform(geom geometry, from_proj text, to_srid integer)
routine.definition: SELECT public.postgis_transform_geometry($1, $2, proj4text, $3) FROM public.spatial_ref_sys WHERE srid=$3;

routine.name: st_transform(geom geometry, to_proj text)
routine.definition: SELECT public.postgis_transform_geometry($1, proj4text, $2, 0) FROM public.spatial_ref_sys WHERE srid=public.ST_SRID($1);
